content:
In the not distant future, wxWidgets will push all their containers to use STD containers beneath the covers. Some of our libs illegally use internal wxWidgets container objects/methods. A notable offender is wxJSON. If I build wxWidgets against their current master branch (they have made the STD change there already) then building O fails with hundreds of declaration errors where the use of internals of certain container members or methods do not exist or no longer have the same name.

Is there a more recent version of wxJSON that works around the use of container internals?

Dan Dickey said:

In the not distant future, wxWidgets will push all their containers to use STD containers beneath the covers. Some of our libs illegally use internal wxWidgets container objects/methods. A notable offender is wxJSON. If I build wxWidgets against their current master branch (they have made the STD change there already) then building O fails with hundreds of declaration errors where the use of internals of certain container members or methods do not exist or no longer have the same name.

Is there a more recent version of wxJSON that works around the use of container internals?

Not that I'm aware of
